result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis L Summers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis L Summers

2:35 PM Defendant Curtis L Summers in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Curtis L Summers.  Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin. State gives recommendation. Plea questionnaire on file.  Counsel to electronically file the signed page of plea questionnaire after hearing. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence. Balance of court costs ($18.00) due forthwith. All conditions of bail continue until report date.
Filed by Atty Ertl

10:30 AM Defendant appears in person, in custody of OZSD, by video. Rachel Boaz appears as a friend of the court stating her office has not been able to find someone to appoint yet and requests a new date.. Atty Lindsay appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant makes a request to modify bail. State is prepared to address and objects to any reduction in bail. Court denies the request. Court continues to find good cause to extend timelimits as the public defender is seeking counsel for the defendant.
Further proceedings scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

B1 hearing case for B3 - 2:06 PM Defendant Curtis L Summers appeared by video in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty. Rachel Boaz. Attorney Benjamin Lindsay appears by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives reading of complaint. Defendant does not qualify for for PD. Court finds probable cause. State recommends $10,000 cash bail w/conditions. There is a probation hold on defendant. Court orders $5000 cash bail w/conditions. Court finds good cause for not scheduling the preliminary hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
